title: Helmet with White Cross

To give assistance or aid to.
nouns: Part of the body at the front of the head
The face is a central organ of sense and is also very central in the expression of emotion among humans and among numerous other species.
Faces are the central sense organ complexes, for those animals that have one, normally on the ventral surface of the head.
The front of the human head from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear
The front part of the head, featuring the eyes, nose, and mouth and the surrounding area.
Act or process of building.
The act of constructing something

Building construction is the process of preparing for and forming buildings and building systems.
The process of constructing.

The construction, rehabilitation, alteration, conversion, extension, demolition or repair of buildings, highways, or other changes or improvement to real property, including facilities providing utility services.
The act or process of building.
A protective helmet, as worn, for example, by a motorcyclist, bicyclist, or soldier in combat.

Any of various forms of protective head covering worn e.g.  by soldiers, firefighters, divers, cyclists, etc.

A protective head covering.
A covering for the head, often in the approximate form of a cone or a cylinder closed at its top end, and sometimes having a brim and other decoration.
An item of clothing worn on a person's head.
Headdress that protects the head from bad weather; has shaped crown and usually a brim

An item of clothing intended to cover the head made from material hard enough to have a shape independant of the skull, and most commonly with a rim.
Head covering

description:
A construction helmet, which is worn by the construction worker emoji in some emoji sets.

The cross on the helmet (shown in the Apple version of this emoji) is used in Japan as a safety reminder in construction zones. It is also commonly seen on the Met helmet in the game Mega Man.
apple_vendor_description: The rescue worker's helmet on Apple devices is a robust symbol of safety and dedication, rendered with Apple's characteristic smooth gradients and soft rounded edges that give it a tangible, protective feel. Its bright orange color, illuminated by subtle highlights, suggests urgency and readiness to help, while the textured surface hints at resilience in challenging environments. This emoji, distinctly designed by Apple, is perfect for messages about emergency services, bravery, or offering support during difficult times, embodying a commitment to well-being.
